result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Lee Casarez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Lee Casarez in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Daniel Lee Casarez.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf for Patricia Daugherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference.  Defendant has a pending case in Waukesha County Case no. 22CF1264 with jury trial set in December 2022 and parties request adjournment to allow time for resolution.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court, defendant Daniel Lee Casarez not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for Attorney Trish Daughtery for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for plea hearing.  Court advised Defendant has been arrested on outstanding warrant from Waukesha County on pending case. Defense has received discovery from the State and requests adjourned scheduling conference. Request granted.  State to submit order to produce.

Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Lee Casarez in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has not received an offer from the State. Court sets the following deadlines:
- 07/01/2022: deadline for the State to extend any intial offers if any are going to be extended.
- 08/05/2022: deadline to file change of plea forms.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Lee Casarez in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Court ordered discovery to be turned over on or before 6/8/22, with the exception of crime lab reports.  Any motions, or change of plea forms due on or before 6/20/22.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Lee Casarez in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
No use or possession of controlled substances or narcotics without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Daniel Lee Casarez in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/15/22 @ 1p
